data.title: Love Nature Debuts in Poland on CANAL+ Polska
data.meta_description: Launch in Poland continues Love Nature’s growth on platforms across Europe and around the world
data.text:
Launch in Poland continues Love Nature’s growth on platforms across Europe and around the world

(London, UK – September 14, 2022) – Love Nature, a wildlife and nature brand with linear and streaming channels available in over 127 countries, announced today its launch into Poland on CANAL+ Polska. Love Nature’s linear 4K channel is now available, fully localized in Polish, to CANAL+ Polska subscribers with 4K set top boxes. Additionally, the platform’s audiences will soon have access to Love Nature’s programs on its VOD service available to DTH subscribers on 4K set top boxes. The launch marks Love Natures debut in Poland and expands the channel’s reach in Europe.

“Love Nature’s new partnership with CANAL+ Polska will provide the best quality 4K natural history programming on the market for CANAL+ audiences and we are delighted to be making our Polish debut with one of Poland’s leading Pay TV operators,” says Chiara Mckee, VP, EMEA Love Nature. “Poland is a key territory for significantly expanding Love Nature’s reach across Europe and the widespread availability of UHD televisions in Polish households will satisfy the growing demand for top quality 4K content.”

“CANAL+ Polska has been one of the pioneers on the Polish market in terms of offering 4K content to its audience, being the first broadcaster in the market to offer a premium 4K HDR Channel. We are very happy to enlarge CANAL+ 4K offering by adding Love Nature’s 4K channel to our portfolio, wild nature being one of the genres where one can really appreciate the difference 4K quality adds to our viewing experience.” says Monika Kłosińska, External Channels’ Acquisition Director, CANAL+ Polska.

Love Nature’s original programming highlights on CANAL+ Polska include:

Becoming Orangutan (3 x 60′), a mini series featuring the irresistible young orangutans at the Borneo Orangutan Survival Foundation as they are nurtured by specially trained caregivers and to learn how to survive in the wild; Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack (6 x 30′), which features the journey of wildlife filmmaker Julz Braatvedt on his mission to film and protect African wild dogs with the Zambian Carnivore Program; Battle of the Alphas (12 x 30’) delves into the science behind animal conflict, from babies competing for their mother’s milk to aggressive battles for territorial leadership; New Kids in the Wild (5 x 60’), which follows the first steps of baby animals from birth and and the fragile first steps to key moments in their lives in which they use their instincts to survive; Dawn to Dusk (8 x 60’), a breathtaking series that celebrates the daily rhythms of wildlife from sunrise to sunset in different extraordinary ecosystems around the world.

Love Nature is available in over 415million households worldwide, via its branded linear and online platforms available in 130+ countries and through key content partnerships with Sky Nature (UK, Germany and Italy), Youku (China), Starhub (Singapore), KPN, VodafoneZiggo (Netherlands) and more. Love Nature is also available in the U.S. as a FAST (free, ad-supported television) channel on growing platforms like The Roku Channel, Samsung TV Plus, VIZIO WatchFree+, Xumo and VIX in the U.S.
